channel.title: Folder Locking
channel.description:
I'm Thinking it's simple to do what I'm looking for, but so far I have had no luck in finding this program. Not sure if it exists, but is there a program that can lock your folders with a password.(More complex that what it sounds). Pics!
[URL=http://imageshack.us][IMG]http://img253.imageshack.us/img253/4858/89857211gm1.png[/img][/URL]
Uh so If I try to open the folder, a prompt box will come up asking me for the pass without the need of having the software installed, just those files to make sure your entering the right password. Anyone ever heard of such a program, I'm tired of lurking =(.

item.title: Folder Locking
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Better yet do what Niall said and share your program with us in the Java section.

I’ve been meaning to writing one for ages, just never got around to it.

Read full topic

item.title: Folder Locking
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

You do know there are things that are obvious to people, so I didn’t mention what you said because it’s obvious. So yes I did google for another program and still are. Sorry.

Read full topic

item.title: Folder Locking
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Java Is My Bitch™, post:7, topic:228180”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=299934.msg2408131#msg2408131 date=1219795309]
Niall is a given name, tard.

EDIT: There are many ways you could do it, the most secure of which is probably hooking the API calls which open the file, unless there is something in NTFS that does this (probably).
[/quote]

I apologize than.

Your first step should have been to google what you wanted:

http://www.google.com/search?q=folder+locking

I get many results that appear to do exactly what you want.

Better yet do what Niall said and share your program with us in the Java section.

I actually did google and found a program that described what I was looking for, but it didn’t work out. I had to encrypt the whole entire volume. I set the volume as my CD drive and put the files in there, it was successful, but then when I uploaded(Web server), it wouldn’t work. It would just open.

If I do succeed in making a program, then of course I will.

Thank you all for your advice.[/quote]Then google for another one…

Read full topic

item.title: Folder Locking
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch Java Is My Bitch™
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:4, topic:228180”]Niall is a given name, tard.

EDIT: There are many ways you could do it, the most secure of which is probably hooking the API calls which open the file, unless there is something in NTFS that does this (probably).[/quote]

I apologize than.

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:6, topic:228180”]Your first step should have been to google what you wanted:

http://www.google.com/search?q=folder+locking

I get many results that appear to do exactly what you want.

Better yet do what Niall said and share your program with us in the Java section. :)[/quote]

I actually did google and found a program that described what I was looking for, but it didn’t work out. I had to encrypt the whole entire volume. I set the volume as my CD drive and put the files in there, it was successful, but then when I uploaded(Web server), it wouldn’t work. It would just open.

If I do succeed in making a program, then of course I will.

Thank you all for your advice.

Read full topic

item.title: Folder Locking
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Niall is a given name, tard.

EDIT: There are many ways you could do it, the most secure of which is probably hooking the API calls which open the file, unless there is something in NTFS that does this (probably).

item.title: Folder Locking
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Well, Java is “your bitch” as implied by your name, so just write a simple file encryption program and place encrypted files in the folder.
